editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msDesc.head: WILLIAM OCKHAM, GILES OF ROME; S. XIV in.

msItem.note: Four structurally independent books; but running heads and marginal annotation in a hand of s. xiv in. show that II-IV at least were together early, and the same brick-red initials throughout suggest that the whole was always so.
At the head of fol. i, s. xiv, trimmed by the binder, is ‘Tractatus Willelmi Ocham de corpore Christi cum multis aliis’. fol. iirv is blank.

supportDesc.extent:
184 leaves (ii + 182) 320 235
The edges retrimmed, with loss of marginalia and running heads, and spattered with red.
supportDesc.collation: A bifolium, 112 / 2–312, 48, 5–812, 94 / 10–1212 / 13–1412, 15–168, 178(+ 1 after 8), a singleton; ornamental catchword to I only. Quires lost after 1.

handDesc.handNote: Several similar gothic rotunda bookhands, probably English.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii; sewn on five bands; formerly chained from the usual position. The outermost leaves were formerly pastedowns in an earlier binding. fol. i has marks of two straps, a brass chain-staple near the foot of the foredge, and of the large iron chain-staple. fol. 184 has marks of two iron clasps.

history.provenance: On fol. iv three inscriptions in the hand of Walterus Roberti: ‘Liber M. Willelmi Reed’ socii domus scolarium de Merton’ in Oxon’ quem de quadam cista ibidem uendicioni expositum emit de bonis sibi datis per reuerendum dominum suum M. Nicholaum de Sandwyco. Oretis igitur pro utroque’; a long table of contents; ‘Liber domus scolarium de Merton’ in Oxon’ in communi libraria eiusdem et ad usum communem magistrorum et sociorum ibidem studencium cathenandus. Ex dono uenerabilis patris domini Willelmi tercii episcopi Cicestrie. Oretis igitur pro eodem et benefactoribus eiusdem ac fidelium animabus a purgatorio liberandis. xxxi uolumen.’ For William Reed, fellow from 1344 until at least 1357, d. 1385, see MS 8. This volume was part of his legacy.
Seen at Merton by John Bale (Appendix C, no. 13).
At the head of fol. 1 is the James no. ‘32’, s. xvii in.

Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with ‘D. 7, 10’ (canc.) and a table of contents, s. xvii, on the board itself ‘O. 3. 9. Art:’, canc. and replaced with ‘L. 1. 8 (CXXXVII)’ in red; the College bookplate.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.

msItem.author: WILLIAM OCKHAM
msItem.title: De Corpore Christi (De Sacramento Altaris pars II)
msItem.rubric: Tractatus W. Okham de corpore Christi.
msItem.incipit: Stupenda superne munera largitatis ad reparacionem generis humani
msItem.explicit: (ends impf. in ch. 37) doctoremque prudentiam et per concilia (catchwords licere reprehendi)

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 60 lines.

msItem.author: GILES OF ROME
msItem.title: Quaestiones de Esse et Essentia
msItem.incipit: Questio est utrum sic dare plura principia simpliciter prima
msItem.explicit: sed habet differentem essentiam ab esse.
msItem.note: Pr. [Leipzig] 1493 &c., Venice 1503 / Frankfurt 1968, fols. 2–35v; Glorieux, Théol. 400aa.

msItem.author: GILES OF ROME
msItem.title: De Ente et Essentia Aurea Theoremata
msItem.incipit: Omne esse est purum per se existens et infinitum uel est parcipatum in alio receptum et limitatum. Volentes de esse tractatum componere ne laborem in equiuoco distinximus
msItem.explicit: et hoc de esse et essentia dicta sufficiant, laus sit Ipsi Deo in quo est omne esse qui ...
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt theoremata de esse et essentia edita a fratre Egidio Romano fratrum heremitarum ordinis sancti Augustini. Deo gratias amen.
msItem.note: The theorems are written in blocks, in larger script on alternate lines. ed. E. Hocedez (Louvain, 1930); Glorieux, Théol. 400f.

msItem.author: GILES OF ROME
msItem.title: De Formatione Humani Corporis
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus de formacione humani corporis in utero editus a fratre Egidio de Roma ordinis fratrum heremitarum sancti Augustini ...
msItem.incipit: Post tractatum de predestinacione et prescientia et de paradyso
msItem.explicit: de declaratis autem atque inuentis tibi quietis auctor et conditor omnium sit laus honor et gloria in s. s. amen. Explicit ...

msItem.author: GILES OF ROME
msItem.title: De Laudibus Diuinae Sapientiae
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus de laudibus diuine sapiencie editus a fratre Egidio.
msItem.incipit: Eructauit cor meum uerbum bonum ...; Inter multas et uarias occupaciones nostras
msItem.explicit: quod quia sine te Domine Iesu Christe finiri non potuit cui sit honor .... Explicit ...

msItem.author: GILES OF ROME
msItem.title: De Praedestinatione et Praescientia
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus de predestinacione et prescientia ... editus a fratre Egidio Romano ordinis fratrum heremitarum sancti Augusti [sic].
msItem.incipit: Nobili militi in Christo sibi quam plurimum dilecto domino Thauene de Thalomeis frater Egidius
Cum in nostro reditu uersus Parysiense studium
Post distinctionem capitulorum restat tractatum componere
msItem.explicit: et adeptus fore tantam gloriam cui glorie nos participes faciat Dominus Iesus Christus qui .... Explicit ...
msItem.note: Pr. Naples 1524 &c., Rome 1554 / Frankfurt 1968; Glorieux, Théol. 400x, not this copy.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 61 lines.

msItem.author: GILES OF ROME
msItem.title: Quaestiones de Compositione Angelorum
msItem.incipit: Questio est utrum angelus intelligat seipsum per essenciam suam
msItem.explicit: et quod per proposita excitetur, et hec de cognicione angelorum sufficiant.
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt questiones disputate de cognicione angelorum edite a fratre Egidio de Roma ordinis fratrum heremitarum sancti Augustini.
msItem.note: Annotated in an anglicana hand little later than the main text.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 62 lines.

msItem.author: GILES OF ROME
msItem.title: Quaestiones Decem de Mensura Angelorum
msItem.incipit: Questio est de mensura angelorum et primo queretur utrum euum siue eternitas participata sit mensura angelorum
msItem.explicit: etiam formaliter est in predicamento qualitatis et hec de mensura angelorum sufficiant.
msItem.note: Pr. Venice 1503 / Frankfurt 1968, fols. 35v-76; Glorieux, Théol. 400n.

msItem.author: GILES OF ROME
msItem.title: Quaestiones Septem de Resurrectione Mortuorum
msItem.incipit: Questio est utrum sit possibilis resurrectio mortuorum
msItem.explicit: et tristabitur uoluntas et hec de questione dicta sufficiant.

msItem.author: GILES OF ROME
msItem.title: Quaestiones de Materia Caeli
msItem.incipit: Questio est utrum in celo sit materia uel sicut celum corpus simpliciter ut posuit commentator
msItem.explicit: quod forma celi contrarietate non habeat.
msItem.note: Followed by a list of the quaestiones in a neat anglicana hand which annotates II-IV.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 61 lines.
